keyword: calories in 1 cup of beans cooked
title: Calories in 1 Cup of Cooked Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup of beans cooked, including protein, carbs, fiber, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in 1 Cup of Cooked Beans
assumptions: Cooked kidney beans, drained and rinsed, no added salt, fat, or seasonings; ~177 g per cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bean type, brand, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 cup of cooked kidney beans provides ~225 kcal and ~15 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil during cooking
Use canned beans with added salt

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of cooked beans?
faqs.a: About 225 kcal for 1 cup cooked kidney beans.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in 1 cup of beans cooked?
Are cooked beans high in fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, ~12.7 g dietary fiber per cup, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Do cooked beans have fat or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Low fat (~0.9 g) and 0 mg cholesterol per cup.

faqs.q: How does bean type affect calories in 1 cup cooked?
faqs.a: Kidney ~225 kcal, black ~215 kcal, chickpeas ~269 kcal; varies slightly.
